beta_blocker.description: First-line choice if patient is not on any rate-controlling medication and does not have severe asthma or COPD.

Bisoprolol.frequency: Once a day or divided twice a day

considerations.when_to_start: If poor rate control (HR > 110), symptomatic AF, or rhythm control with class Ic (Flecainide) is used.
considerations.when_to_adjust: If already on beta-blocker, increase only one level at a time.
considerations.when_to_avoid: Severe asthma, severe COPD, heart rate < 50 in ECG, type II or type III AV block in ECG, average heart rate < 55 in Holter ECG, slow AF in Holter ECG, any symptom during slow AF in Holter ECG. If bisoprolol cannot be given in HFrEF, switch to digoxin.

calcium_channel_blocker.description: Second-line option when beta-blockers are contraindicated.

Diltiazem.frequency: Three times a day or twice a day for elderly

considerations.when_to_avoid: Should NOT be given to patients with LVEF < 41% or history of heart failure. Avoid diltiazem and verapamil in HFrEF.

digoxin.description: Third-line option when beta-blockers and CCBs are not suitable.

considerations.when_to_start: If beta-blockers and CCBs are contraindicated. If bisoprolol cannot be given in HFrEF, switch to digoxin.
considerations.when_to_add: Can be added to beta-blockers or CCBs if patient remains symptomatic despite maximum dosage.

management_guidelines.consider_average_heart_rate: If ECG or Holter is more than two weeks old, use the average heart rate from physical examination as the determining factor.

criteria: Minimal or no symptoms or rate control not needed
Highly symptomatic (palpitations with shortness of breath, affecting daily life)
Rhythm control with class Ic agents (Propafone, Flecainide)
actions: Increase beta-blocker dose (one level at a time)
Switch to or add a calcium channel blocker if beta-blockers are contraindicated
Consider adding Digoxin if both beta-blockers and CCBs are at maximum tolerated doses

combination_therapy_considerations.if_max_dosage_reached_and_still_symptoma: Consider adding the next class of medication at the lowest dose.

management_guidelines.medication_dosage_restriction: GPT should only provide medication dosages listed in this document.
